title: Brief Addiction Monitor (BAM)
description: Assesses substance use-related behaviors, risk factors, and protective factors over the past 30 days

parameters.name: physical_health
parameters.description: How would you say your physical health has been? (past 30 days)

parameters.name: sleep_troubles
parameters.description: How many nights have you had trouble falling asleep or staying asleep? (past 30 days)

parameters.name: emotional_distress
parameters.description: How many days have you felt depressed, anxious, angry or very upset throughout most of the day? (past 30 days)

parameters.name: alcohol_use
parameters.description: How many days have you drunk ANY alcohol? (past 30 days)

parameters.name: alcohol_intoxication
parameters.description: How many days have you been drunk or intoxicated? (past 30 days)

parameters.name: illegal_drug_use
parameters.description: How many days have you used illegal drugs or abused prescribed medication? (past 30 days)

parameters.name: marijuana_use
parameters.description: How many days have you used marijuana (cannabis, pot, weed)? (past 30 days)

parameters.name: cravings
parameters.description: How much have you been bothered by cravings or urges to drink alcohol or use drugs? (past 30 days)

parameters.name: abstinence_confidence
parameters.description: How confident are you in your ability to be completely abstinent (clean) from alcohol and drugs in the next 30 days?

parameters.name: self_help_attendance
parameters.description: How many days have you attended self-help meetings like AA or NA to support recovery? (past 30 days)

parameters.name: risky_situations
parameters.description: How many days were you in situations or with people that might put you at an increased risk for using alcohol or drugs? (past 30 days)

parameters.name: spiritual_support
parameters.description: How much does your religion or spirituality help support your recovery?

parameters.name: work_participation
parameters.description: How many days did you attend work, school, or volunteer activities? (past 30 days)

parameters.name: income_adequate
parameters.description: Do you have enough income (from legal sources) to pay for necessities?

parameters.name: family_conflicts
parameters.description: How stressful have things been between you and your family and/or significant others? (past 30 days)

parameters.name: social_support
parameters.description: How many days have you been in contact or spent time with family and/or friends who are supportive of your recovery? (past 30 days)

parameters.name: recovery_satisfaction
parameters.description: How satisfied are you with your progress toward achieving your recovery goals?

result.name: bam_score
result.description: Total BAM score and subscale scores

ranges.interpretation: Higher scores indicate worse outcomes. Use subscale scores for detailed assessment.

references: Cacciola JS, Alterman AI, DePhilippis D, et al. Development and initial evaluation of the Brief Addiction Monitor (BAM). J Subst Abuse Treat. 2013;44(3):256-63.
Nelson KG, Young K, Chapman H. Examining the performance of the Brief Addiction Monitor. J Subst Abuse Treat. 2014;46(4):472-81.
McDonell MG, Kerbrat AH, Comtois KA, et al. Validation of the Brief Addiction Monitor in United States Veterans with Substance Use Disorders. Addict Behav. 2016;63:118-24.
formula: Total Score = Sum of all 17 items; Use Factors = Q4-7; Risk Factors = Q1-3,8,11,15; Protective Factors = Q9-10,12-14,16-17
notes: Higher scores indicate worse substance use-related behaviors and outcomes
Questions use 30-day time frame except for confidence question (Q9)
Validated in adults with substance use disorders
Subscales allow assessment of specific domains: use, risk, and protective factors
